poem:
"Deferring Digital Dawns"

The child should not awaken to a screen,
Nor carry the weight of unwanted digital dreams,
Until the sparrows have sung 'thirteen.' 
And as the seasons circle to eighteen,
Warble of wild winds, not a social scene,
Conscience their compass, not emojis' gleam, 
Let France unfurl an unprecedented roadmap,
Preserve innocence, in an ever-spinning lap.

The French president had asked scientists and experts to suggest screen use guidelines for children with a view to France taking unprecedented steps". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
